alert.note: Alert for Lamar; Pike; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 8:50AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Pike, northern Monroe, northern Upson and Lamar Counties through 945 AM EDT... At 849 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Johnstonville to Atwater, and moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary minor flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Thomaston, Barnesville, Forsyth, Zebulon, Milner, Molena, Meansville, Aldora, The Rock, Sunset Village, Concord, Atwater, Hilltop, Blount, Liberty Hill, Hannahs Mill, Collier, Johnstonville, Goggins and Berner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EDT for parts of central and west central Georgia.
